reasoning: Lipoid nephrosis (minimal change disease) is the most common cause of nephrotic syndrome in children, with estimated pediatric incidence of 1-2 per 100,000 children per year. Global estimate ~1.5 per 100k averaged across age groups. Subtype of nephrotic syndrome with specific histopathology.
source: Kidney Disease: Improving Global Outcomes (KDIGO) Clinical Practice Guidelines for Glomerulonephritis
